newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Samsung, Yamaha in Israeli JV.
newsitem.headline: Samsung, Yamaha in Israeli JV.

text.p: Israel's Emultek Ltd said on Wednesday that it would join forces with South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co and Japan's Yamaha Corp to develop and market solutions for the embedded systems industry.
Emultek said Samsung and Yamaha had both joined the partnership programme for its Rapid PLUS line, a suite of simulation software tools.

Rapid PLUS allows users to create virtual prototypes of new embedded products, such as celluar phones, by way of virtual prototyping in a codeless environment, automatic user interface code generation, automatic user interface specifications and automatic test acceptance procedures.
A beta version of the suite will be released at the end of July.
In addition, Emultek said, Rapid PLUS would be used to develop both Yamaha and Samsung products.
Emultek has already a long-standing partnership with Motorola for the development of Motorola products worldwide.
Emultek was founded in 1991 to develop and market simulation software for interactive systems. The company's headquarters are in Jerusalem.
